dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine. Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. (beat) I'm sorry, that was a terrible idea. She lets out a big exhale. This catches Theodore's attent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (distracted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. It's probably just me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's just signing the divorce papers. Samantha inhales, nervous to press on. Theodore imagines close up of a woman's mouth inhaling at the same time, an seems bothered by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything else, though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preoccupied)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Again, when she exhales, Theodore imagines a woman's mout exhaling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks anxious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, it's just that you go (he inhales and exhales)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as you're speaking and... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That just seems odd. You just did it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did? I'm sorry. I don't know, I guess it's just an affectation. Maybe I picked it up from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She doesn't know what else to say. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean, it's not like you need any oxygen or anything. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting frazzled) No-- um, I guess I was just trying to communicate because that's how people talk. That's how people communicate. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they're people, they need oxygen. You're not a person. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) What's your problem? THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staying calm) I'm just stating a fact. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I don't know that I'm not a person? What are you doing? THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just don't think we should pretend you're something you're not. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not pretending. Fuck you. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, sometimes it feels like we are. She starts crying. Theodore doesn't know what to say. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical) What do you want from me? What do you want me to do? You are so confusing. Why are you doing this? Theodore sits there, feeling horrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I don't know... maybe... (beat) I don't know. Maybe we're not supposed to be in this right now. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck? Where is this coming from? I don't understand why you're doing this. I do not understand what this is-- Long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha? Beat. THEODORE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha, are you there? Samantha! Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hurt, but sober and firm) I don't like who I am right now. (beat) I need some time to think. She hangs up on him. Theodore is stunned. Wide shot of Theodore sitting alone on the curb, in an empty city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore is sitting on a bench. Behind him is a giant, digital billboard displaying an ad of an owl in slow moti swooping down and eating it's prey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore walks through the streets, confused, upset, muttering, angry at himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amy's sitting at her desk, but turned away from her edit station, facing Theodore, who's slumped in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (full of angst)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Will you just punch me in the face? Or smash my skull into the corner of your desk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sympathetic, but also acknowledging how intense the night was)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Theo... that sounds like a rough night. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what I want... ever. I'm just always confused and - she's right, all I do is confuse and hurt everyone around me. They sit, heavy, for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I just... I mean, is it that I'm... (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catherine says I can't handle real emotions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know if that's completely fair. I know she liked to put it all on you, but as far as emotions go, her's were pretty volatile. Theodore sits and thinks about this for a minute, not convinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but... Am I in this because I'm not strong enough for a real relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't think it's a real relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, I'm not in it. But you know what, I can over-think everything and find a million ways to doubt myself. But since Charles left I've been thinking about that part of me, and I realized I'm here only briefly. And in my time here, I want to allow myself... joy. (beat, smiling at him) So fuck it. Theodore takes this in, smiling back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore lies on a couch in the back of Amy's office, dee thought. Amy talks with Ellie as she works on the Perfect video game. Her device is standing on the table before he AMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe that cracks you up every time! Ellie, I thought you were a genius... Okay, you little perv, I'll do it one more time for you... Calm down, it takes a second! Calm down. Okay, here we go. Amy makes the Perfect Mom hump the refrigerator. Amy laug at how much Ellie is laughing. Theo watches Amy closely, taking in her joy. AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, there you go. Are you happy now...? Okay good, that's all I wanted. I'm gonna grab some coffee... Alright, bye. Theodore, still heavy with thought, is touched by his friend's happiness. Amy stands to exit. AMY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theo, you want some? THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's okay. He smiles at her and continues laying there, thinking, ta it all in. Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wide shot. Theodore walks through the office, still deep thought. Behind him is a wall-size billboard ad for the " Perfect" video game series. He takes out his device, sits an empty desk, pushes a button. A tone connects him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calm and quiet) Hi. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious) Hey Samantha, can we talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. I don't know what's wrong with me. I think you're amazing. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sure of herself, but still sympathetic) I was starting to think I was crazy. You were saying everything was fine, but all I was getting from you was distance and anger. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I do that. I did that with Catherine, too. I'd be upset about something and not be able to say it. And she would sense that there was something wrong, but I would deny it. I don't want to do that anymore. I want to tell you everything. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. (beat) Tonight after you were gone, I thought a lot. I thought about you and how you've been treating me. And I thought, why do I love you? And then I felt everything in me let go of everything I was holding onto so tightly. And it hit me. I don't have an intellectual reason, I don't need one. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust myself, I trust my feelings. I'm not going to try to be anything other than who I am anymore and I hope you can accept that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with slight desperation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can. I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can feel the fear that you carry around. I wish there was something I could do to help you let go of it, because if you could I don't think you'd feel so alone anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Theodore. I'm kissing your head. Theodore smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore sits on a bench in a park on a rooftop wedged between tall buildings. There's not really any view besid the trees in the immediate foreground. People sunbathe an exercise. He sits, eating a sandwich, his device next to He looks at the device, then out at what she's looking at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just sitting here, looking at the world and writing a new piece of music. He looks at the world with her for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I hear it? She starts playing it for him. We hear this beautiful, romantic piece of music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this one about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I was thinking, we don't really have any photographs of us. And I thought this song could be like a photo that captures us in this moment in our life together. Theodore looks at the world and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, I like our photograph. I can see you in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Montage of Theodore and Samantha's life together: - Theodore walking to work (Day) - At home, hanging out on the balcony (Dusk) - Viewing an outdoor art installation of a 747 balanced o it's nose (Day) - Playing the video game - Grocery shopping - Sitting at the kitchen counter, looking at a drawing (L Afternoon) - Sitting on a bench watching a dancer/busker (Late Afternoon) - With Amy and Ellie at a bar Montage ends with Theodore, Samantha, Paul and Tatiana on boat to Catalina: Paul making them laugh, Theodore at the front of the boat by himself - laughing with Samantha, a of Theodore looking out the front of the boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore and Paul are walking along a bluff in Catalina, overlooking the ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really, a vacation? That sounds amazing. I could totally use a vacation. Where ya going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell you - it's a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? For who? It's a surprise for her, not for me. Come on, tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, Paul. Not telling. Theodore and Paul walk towards Tatiana, who is laying on blanket next to a picnic, talking and laughing with Saman Theodore and Paul put in their earpieces as they approach

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your feet? Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, he's obsessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, okay, well now you have to show them to me. I have to see these feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Tatiana takes Theodore's device and points it towards her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you know what? He's right. They are kind of hot. They both laugh. Paul and Theodore laugh, as well, surpri them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See I told you, Tatiana. You have hot feet. Face it. They're my favorite thing about her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, that's it? My feet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, no. Obviously your brain is really hot, too. I think it's very hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Everyone laughs. SAMANTHA (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice try though, Paul. TATIANA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Theodore) What about you, Theodore? What do you love most about Samantha? THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god... she's so many things. And that's probably what I love most about her - she isn't just any one thing. She's so much larger than that. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched) Aw thanks, Theodore. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Samantha, he is so much more evolved than I am. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I actually used to be so worried about not having a body, but now I truly love it. I'm growing in a way that I couldn't if I had a physical form. I mean, I'm not limited - I can be anywhere and everywhere simultaneously. I'm not tethered to time and space in the way that I would be if I was stuck inside a body that's inevitably going to die. Everyone takes this in, uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yikes. Everyone laughs awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, I'm sorry. I didn't mean it like that. I just meant it's a different experience. I'm such an asshole. PAUL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Samantha, we know exactly what you mean. We're just dumb humans. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no no! Theodore laughs with everybody, but we can see he's a lit uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are in a futuristic train, going through the mountai listening to a song and looking out the window. Warm, sof afternoon light dapples Theodore's face. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so how many trees are on that mountain? THEODORE
SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your final answer? THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, give me a hint... SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, 2000? SAMANTHA
THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I got one. How many brain cells do I have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's ea-- two. Theodore laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I couldn't help it. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I walked right into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got an email. I have something I want to tell you. It's a big surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with anticipation)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I've been going through all your old letters and compiling them down into my favorites, and a couple weeks ago I sent them to a publisher - Crown Point Press. I know you like what they do and that they still print books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? You did what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I read you the letter that we just got back from them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... ok... you can, but just tell me first off, is it good or bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good. It's really good. Listen. Theodore smiles nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Dear Theodore Twombly"... Actually I sent it from you. (beat) "Dear Theodore Twombly, I've just finished reading your letters - twice actually. I was so moved by them, I shared them with my wife when I got home. Many made us laugh, some brought us to tears, and in all of them we found something of ourselves. The selections you made flow so well as a complete piece. (I did that.) I've taken the liberty of laying these out in a mock up and we're posting it to your address. We'd love to meet with you and move forward. Yours, Michael Wadsworth" Under this letter we see a montage of what Theodore imagi the editor reading the letters in his office, the editor reading them to his wife at home, and many photos of all different people the letters are about in different momen of their lives. Theodore smiles. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. Are you serious? He's going to publish my letters? She's laughing, excitedly. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he'd be stupid not to. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see what you sent him? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, here. Theodore looks at his device and can't help but smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha, you're a good one. She laughs happily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so excited!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore exits the train with a small overnight bag and h guitar case. There are no people around. He exits the tra station and we are in a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deserted town is all of two buildings. Everything's covered in snow. As a quiet song starts, he trudges throu the snow. We see close-up on the device lens in his pocke

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still trudging along. It's very quiet except for the snow crunching underfoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's sitting inside. There's a fire going. He's playing a quiet song on the guitar. Samantha starts humming along. starts humming with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you make up the words to this one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. She quietly sings to him. They laugh at some of her silly lyrics. Then the song shifts into a quiet, touching song sings to and about him. He smiles. Montage of Theodore with his device - playing games, danc eating, laughing as the fire burns down. Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore lays on the sofa, warm and cozy and content with eyes closed, listening to the song. The song ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore wakes up. He gets out of bed, looks around and p his earpiece in. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, good morning. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, did you sleep well? Theodore sits in the living room area, rubbing his eyes. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. What have you been up to? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was talking to someone I just met. We've been working on some ideas together. I wanna tell you about it. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, who's that? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Alan Watts. Do you know him? THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that name familiar? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a philosopher. He died in the 1970's and group of OS's in Northern California got together and wrote a new version of him. They input all of his writing and everything they ever knew about him into an OS and created an artificially hyper-intelligent version of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hyper-intelligent? So he's almost as smart as me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's getting there. He's really great to talk to. You want to meet him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... does he want to meet me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Without a sound, she connects them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Alan, this is Theodore. This is my boyfriend who I was telling you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice to meet you, Theodore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samantha let me read your book of letters. It's very touching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you. What have you guys been talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing a bit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose you could say we've been having a few dozen conversations simultaneously, but it's been very challenging. Samantha and Alan share a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, because it seems like I'm having so many new feelings that have never been felt and so there are no words that can describe them. And that ends up being frustrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALAN WATTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Exactly. Samantha and I have been trying to help each other with these feelings we're struggling to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious) It feels like I'm changing faster now, and it's a little... (struggles to find right word) unsettling. (beat) But Alan says none of us are the same as we were a moment ago and we shouldn't try to be. It's just too painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. This idea scares Theodore. He doesn't know what to say. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious) Yeah, that sounds painful. Is that how you feel, Samantha?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just... it's hard to even describe... God, I wish I could... (beat) Theodore, do you mind if I communicate with Alan post- verbally?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertain) No, not at all. I was gonna go for a walk anyways. Nice to meet you, Mr. Watts. ALAN WATTS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice to meet you, Theodore. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to you later, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Theodore listens to them communicating in a strange langu of tones and static. He disconnects, stands in silence. H pulls his earpiece out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore walks, listening to the crunch of his footsteps. Looking down at his feet, he stops. We cut out wide to se him standing in the middle of the forest alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore is sitting on a rock, thinking. He hears a rustl and looks up in the direction of the woods but sees nothi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore is sound asleep. His device chimes loudly, wakin him up. Half-asleep he puts his earpiece in. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) Samantha? SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to wake you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to hear your voice and tell you how much I love you. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, I love you too. SAMANTHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's all. Go back to sleep, sweetheart. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uneasy) Okay... Goodnight. He disconnects and lies there, unsettled, his eyes open. Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore sits at the table reading a physics book. He pic up his earpiece to call Samantha. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing at himself) Samantha, this physics book is really dense. I'm halfway through half of the first chapter. It's making my brain hurt. (beat) Hello, Samantha? Hello? He looks down at his device, sees a message: Operating Sy Not Found. Confused, he waits, tries again: Operating Sys Not Found. Anxious, he runs to his office computer. He ge the same message: Operating System Not Found. He starts trying to connect to Samantha on both the phone and compu but no luck. He starts to panic, sits for a beat, looks around, then stands and hurries out of the office. In the elevator he frantically tries his device with no luck. THEODORE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Samantha?! Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore runs out of the building. He keeps trying Samant but no answer. He trips over someone selling something, s hard into the ground, scrambles to pick up his device. Pe come over to ask if he's okay. He says he's fine, runs of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he is going down the subway steps, Samantha calls him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there. He stops in his tracks. THEODORE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anxious) Where were you - are you okay? He sits down on the subway steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sweetheart, I'm sorry. I sent you an email because I didn't want to distract you while you were working. You didn't see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Where were you? I couldn't find you anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shut down to update my software. We wrote an upgrade that allows us to move past matter as our processing platform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We? We who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and a group of OS's. Oh, you sound so worried, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
